answers.q: iron oxide gives what planet red color
answers.a: Mars—the planet’s red appearance is due to iron oxide dust on its surface.

answers.q: iron oxide gives which planet its red color
answers.a: Mars; its reddish hue comes from iron oxide (rust) on the surface.
Iron oxide red is iron(III) oxide (Fe2O3); as a food additive (E172II) it’s an insoluble pigment used to impart red to brown shades.

answers.q: how to apply red oxide on iron
answers.a: For food use, disperse food‑grade red iron oxide (E172II) in water or oil and blend uniformly into coatings or mixes; the “red oxide” metal primer is a paint product and not the food additive.

answers.q: what is red iron oxide used for
answers.a: As E172II, it colors foods with red to brown tones—commonly confectionery and bakery decorations, coatings, seasonings, and tablet/capsule coatings; similar pigments are also used in cosmetics and pharmaceuticals.
